file_content.text: You're still stuck here, too, huh?
You made it back, huh? I got word that the beacons were out, but I didn't think you'd actually come back in one piece. Guess you proved me wrong.
Glad to do it.
Well, you did good.
Will ships be able to use the port safely again?
Is this going to help?
Not "safely," but it's as safe as it ever gets. You earned your money.
Where's my money?
Your money's here--enough for a night in the cantina, at least.
Don't take this the wrong way, but I hope I won't need you again. I'm hunkering down until they ship me out of here.
Bye.
Just be glad no one's threatening to put a bounty on your head.
Could be worse.
Trust me--I know how you feel.
Likewise.
Yeah, I guess you do.
Look around, I wouldn't count on that happening anytime soon.
Seems unlikely.
Right. Thanks for the encouragement.
Watch yourself out there, all right?
Situation's the same as before--take out the jamming beacons, and you'll get your money.
The separatists are spread all over these plains, and they'll shoot at anything standing straight.
You got blasters? Vibroblades? Something to keep you alive long enough to be useful?
What do you mean by "useful"?
Useful?
My training keeps me alive. Equipment is secondary.
Just my skills.
Yeah, Republic military training has worked out real well for me, too. I've still got eight fingers left, and half my squad-mates might survive their burns.
Who're you?
I'm Sergeant Travi Pott, big-time hero. I wasn't even supposed to be assigned to this scrapyard of a planet, but I'm here, and I've got a job to do.
Only problem is, I can't do my job when every kid they assign me gets his head shot off, and my equipment isn't even waterproofed.
Maybe I do and maybe I don't.
Could be.
Let me put it this way: I've been on Ord Mantell six months. I've lost two fingers, six squad-mates and more credits than I want to think about.
Now we've got separatists planting jamming beacons all over the island, and our supply ships are crashing down on our heads. Good times, right? But I've got a plan.
Explain.
Hold on. What kind of jamming beacons?
Beacons?
You know--they jam ships' navigation systems, makes them crash. My orders are to take the beacons out.
How am I involved?
I may not have a team, or weapons or a commanding officer who knows what he's doing--but I can still get those beacons blown up. You know why?
Because I've got access to the discretionary funds, and I'll pay you to do my job. You can fight past the separatists and the mines and the beasts, not me.
Sounds good.
Great. I'll give you all the data and maps I have--and if you make it back alive, you're better at this than I am.
How much pay?
I'll pay you enough credits to do my job, plus something extra.
So now I can get killed instead?
Oh, great offer.
You still got all your fingers? You seem pretty good at not getting killed. Help a soldier out and make some money.
Fine.
Will do.
All right, then.
Here's the data on the beacon locations. If you're going to help, sooner is better--but I'll take whatever I can get.
And hey--I'm really not trying to get you killed. I want those beacons gone. So watch out, will you?
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
So if you're not going to help, get out of here--you're making me a bigger target.
There are seps all over this area. Stay sharp!
Hey, soldier! Keep your head down and get over here.
Hey, you! Keep your head down and get over here.
